My friends that were loyal patrons (when they fly in from LA a bunch of us would meet here) have noticed the same thing. We won't be going back...unless things go back to normal.
label: Complaint

review: Order was placed at 3:06P via mobile suppose to be ready at 3:12P didn't get served until 3:25P after I arrived at 3:10P waited and watched 6 people get served in front of me!!!! Called after I left talk to manger he apologized and let me know they were short staff.
label: Complaint

review: Less than stellar experience  service was good everything else no. Ordered farmers platter out of ribs  back up prime rib out of that as well. Opted for fried chicken specified thighs  got three pieces of 95% breading with dried out white meat sent this back next three were just as bad (18.99 to boot!). Won't be returning any time soon. Really missed the mark.
label: Complaint

review: The drinks were good. Bartender did his thing. Our waiter was personable and fun. But the food was lacking taste and heat. How do french fries come to the table lukewarm. My table mate said her chicken was overcooked  zapped too long in the microwave probably. My falafel was a crunchy dust ball. It was topped with what looked like ketchup. But the green salad it was on was fresh  it didn't have sauce but I guess the ketchup was the sauce. There was a side salad ordered by another table mate that was fresh. So they got the salad part right but they clearly need work in other areas.
label: Complaint

review: First time at JD. Ordered take out: Kung pao chicken  shrimp Lomein  firecracker chicken  fried dumplings & eggrolls. Nothing was particularly great or good. Not sure we would order again  as everything was a bit dry & over cooked. On a positive note  they are punctual. We showed up 15 minutes early  as from past experiences with take out orders  the food is usually ready before we arrive & we were trying to avoid picking up cold food. The girl that works there made it clear that she did not appreciate us arriving early... she told us very curtly  as she handed us our order 15 minutes later  we should call next time if we want to pick up early. Very odd way to interact with a customer  since we never made a fuss upon arrival and told them we were happy to wait  cuz we knew we were 15 minutes early.
label: Complaint

review: When did pizza become such a rip-off? For $30 I expected more than a long rectangle of chewy bread  a scant suggestion of sauce less toppings in the center  and a box with the precious Vetri name (even though he no longer owns it). The shape is for sure a clever way to increase the cheaper crust to pricier topping ratio. Really  people  buy a pizza stone and see how easy  cheap & fast it is to make excellent pizza yourself at home. You'll start calling these center city joints a rip-off too.
label: Complaint

review: Gave them our number. Didn't receive text. We had only ordered fries and drinks. So after 20 minutes went up to ask. Then got cold fries and Luke warm sodas.
label: Complaint

review: If you've been to the location in St. Pete ... keep going there; no need to try this one. Thank me later. -Bruschetta - Half soggy  half hard  bread didn't seem fresh. -Gnocchi - Better at the St. Pete location  and had quite a spice/kick to it here. *Chicken Piccata - They don't serve it at the Tampa location. *Lobster Mac - They don't serve it. May be seasonal. *Fries - Those were good. -Bread - I feel like St. Pete serves bread prior to meal. The Tampa location did not. -Blackberry Ginger Smash - It was good.
label: Complaint

review: Didn't care for it. Cute concept & love the name but the chicken was overly seasoned. The fries were basic as well.
label: Complaint

review: Chicago prices for sub par food. They start you out with some stale bread. In group of 6  Ordered 4 lackluster starters. Dry cardboard like truffle French fries  calamari that was basically just fried batter  escargot swimming in a butter bath. The pork belly that was just OK. But the waiter sure went on about how fantastic and perfect everything on the menu was. When the mains came  I found the sides to be unapealimy angus mid rare filet mignon over cooked but did have nice flavor. I should have sent it back but I was in a large party and at that point and was ready to move on with the evening.
label: Complaint

review: Very generic Tex-mex with very pungent garlic. Only reason I gave it 2 stars was because the alcohol is pretty cheap.
label: Complaint

review: I've come here every year for my birthday for the past 9 years. I was disappointed this year. Bring back the freshly baked bread. Pretzel bread does not taste well with oil and Parmesan cheese.
label: Complaint

review: I haven't eaten my food yet so I am extra bitter and maybe rambling on. I ordered chicken flautas -- noting that I wanted EXTRA guacamole. Order arrives and obviously no extra guacamole. Ugh. Sometimes folks forget. Times is hard. I forget. So I called. They proceed to tell me that the flautas don't come with guacamole. That is why they charged me for it. That I am wrong. That it isn't on the menu. Ahhhhhh. Also missing is the shredded lettuce but I don't need that. Also also didn't get the correct salsa I asked for. But none of that matters to me. Just my guacamole. Give me my guacamole  you liars.
label: Complaint

review: It's hard to find really tasty Chinese food. Combination fried rice  egg drop soup and low mein had zero flavor. I am giving 2 stars for the sesame chicken and chicken curry had a little more taste. The staff was super friendly but food lack spice and flavor.
label: Complaint

review: I've come here at least 3 times now and have always had great service and decent food. However  I came here with my friend last night and they forgot to put whiskey in her whiskey sour  my food came out 20 minutes later than my friend so they had to reheat her dish while she waited for my food to come out  and we had to flag down other employees to tend to us as our waiter did not. The trout I ordered was also over salted. The espresso martini was pretty good though. For the price and expectation of this place I expect nothing less than a stellar experience; especially service-wise. Disappointed to say the least.
label: Complaint

review: Disappointing...... We were excited to get a reservation on New Years Eve....even though they said sold out.....LOTS of empty tables..... 8pm......already out of their $5 Sourdough bread....so we order the flat bread....which was only a few slices....and drenched in oil....not good.... We ordered the oysters as an appetizer....the were the size of my thumb nail....and very fishy. You hate to complain  and ruin the mood on New Years Eve.....but we left very disappointed.....
label: Complaint

review: Let me start off with the positive open late with a limited menu. Great friendly staff location has a good beer selection. The pizza appears to be good.. then I try it .. unfortunately the flavor from piece to piece varies drastically. The first piece was hard and burned on the bottom with almost no flavor with heavy sauce at the crust  not across the whole pie. Then the second piece was better more balanced and not burned. Late night downtown Indy choices are limited. Maybe your luck would be better maybe I just got a bad pie. Hmmmmm maybe next time it will be better.
label: Complaint

review: We came here a couple of weeks back on a Saturday night. Rushed our dinner to get there before the 8pm closing time. At 7:45pm they were waving us off like flies saying too late the store had closed. So rude! It's Saturday night and we wanted an after dinner sweet. Will not be back. Crazy they shut so early anyway.
label: Complaint

review: I am sorry to share a poor review about this business but we have choices to make when we get something to eat at a restaurant. Not sure if new owners need to step up the quality but the pizza was poor at best! I hope this restaurant will improve because of it's location is convenient. Give it a try. Beware!
label: Complaint

review: This buffet isn't anything special. The food was subpar but the server was nice and attentive. We were surprised at the lack of offerings; pretty standard Chinese fare. For comparison  we ate at another Chinese buffet in Nampa where they have a huge spread. We found the desserts sorely lacking so we stuck with the soft serve ice cream machine. Their fruit offerings are pretty good. The chow mein was bland and the egg rolls were greasy. Lack of beef dishes as well. We were extremely surprised when we walked in that the prices were not advertised. We did our homework before we chose the restaurant and saw that on their website a weekday lunch is listed at $9.75. As soon as the server brought us or drinks she also left the check. To our dismay we were being charged $13.25 each which is the dinner price. We called the server over and asked her about the price and she said because it's a holiday. We didn't go on Thanksgiving or Easter; we went on MLK day. Totally ridiculous and price gouging! We are definitely one and done with this place!
label: Complaint

review: Outrageous wait times even when there are many open tables and servers. We waited in line for 30 minutes just to be told it'll be an additional 30 minutes when there was 4 servers. The same thing happened to our party on a previous day when we tried to eat here  but then we were told it would be an additional hour on top of what we had already spent in line. Just go somewhere else to eat  you'll be back in the same amount of time.
label: Complaint

review: The food is a no for me. Flavorless. Only up side about this place is they're open late on a weeknight and if you're starved you can get some bland food.
label: Complaint

review: Service was good  but food was not! I rarely write reviews  but had to share. My favorite salad is the Chicken quesadilla explosion salad. So  I know how it should look when it comes out. However  it was not recognizable and I told the server that's not what I ordered. She assured me it was  but it had very little lettuce  which was not fresh and it was already drenched with salad dressing. It was covered with sliced chicken  tons of overcooked tortilla strips and worst of all the cheese quesadilla triangles looked like they were left out overnight and place on the plate. I told the server my issues and she apologized  but I don't feel comfortable returning to this location.
label: Complaint

review: I expected more during our first experience at Carlucci's for dinner. Service was sub par and the indoor space is a little outdated however  comfortable. Food and drinks were OK but nothing to remember because it seemed overpriced.
label: Complaint

review: The Campbell location is an excellent  well-managed cafe with exceptional food and staff. We tried the Broadway location today. The food was mediocre in comparison and the service...what service? There are better places. Go to the Campbell location or try Bisquits a few doors down. Much better elsewhere.
label: Complaint

review: I had high hopes and ordered the Pho  but what a disappointment. It was luke warm and was basically water and noodles. I took it back and asked them for flavor and they said they forgot the broth flavoring. The staff added the broth and I added hoisin and sriracha  yet it was still terrible. A friend ordered another item and it was subpar too. Lastly  for a name like Lil Dumplings you would expect more options with dumplings. They only had three choices   but out of two.
label: Complaint

review: Do you like a salty Pizza? Took out two large plains...Don't know at what part of the process some genius decided to make the finished product overly salty.... but that what it is. Did they get the wrong high schooler preparing the sauce this time... I can only guess... result for my family.. high sodium pizza. imo.. not safe for older folks..
label: Complaint

review: It used to be good before the plannedemic 2020. Food is extra greasy now. Meat doesn't taste fresh like it used to be. Rice even tastes fake.
label: Complaint

review: The poor girl behind the counter has been slaving over online orders and walk-in orders for 20 minutes now. There's 4 of us in line  it shouldn't take this long. There shouldn't be just one employee handling all of this. Hire more employees and stop running out of fish (at a poke place) before 7pm. Step it up.
label: Complaint

review: I honestly cannot give Great Basin Brewing a good review. I wanted to like it since new ownership took over however my fish & chips & fries all were served cold  my husbands burger served cold. I informed the waitress and she microwaved my fish; It just made it soggy. The manager was kind enough to take it off my bill. I was so craving tasteful fish & chips this was definitely not the place for that. This is no Liberty on Sierra Street.
label: Complaint

review: It doesn't look like much when you walk by it  but when you get your food... you're right. It's nothing spectacular and they were out of a lot of things  like hash browns  spinach  and a few others. The coffee was pretty bad  but the music was the only thing that kept me from leaving. The pancakes were alright  but again  nothing special. The service was pretty slow  and usually the food makes up for it  but not in this case. The only thing that was special about this place was their band  but you can listen to them without eating there. If you do go here  if they are playing  tip the band. They deserve it!
label: Complaint

review: They aren't getting things right the last few times we've been there. They keep forgetting things in the bag. Another example just recently ordered egg and cheese biscuit  spicy chicken biscuit  3 hashbrowns. Got home only got two sandwiches had to run back up to get the hashbrowns got back home and wish would have opened up sandwiches cause got two reg chicken biscuits. The order on the bag had two stickers with exactly the order but none of the right food. Happening a lot there lately and super frustrating! Hashbrowns soggy and cold and one was barely filled...geesh
label: Complaint

review: It's a pretty location  seems inviting until you get asked by the host to be sat at the bar  there's no one in the restaurant  we sit for 10 minutes at our table and have multiple people including the bartender walk by and glance our way. Instead of asking to be sat somewhere else I see 4 servers and the host just chilling at the host stand doing nothing so we left. Food smelled great and I'm sure the drinks were good but I'd pass this location by.
label: Complaint

review: I do not know how this place got such. High Yelp review. The restaurant itself is super tiny and cold. It was probably warmer outside. Eating our food wasn't enjoyable just because of how cold it was. I got the brown sugar boba. I don't know if it tasted like Soap or what. It wasn't good. Definitely wasn't sweet. If you want some good brown sugar boba  go to Whale Tea. Also  the boba itself wasn't even that good. They just had it in a container. I got the garlic chicken ramen. Absolutely so flavor. The chicken pieces had no flavor. Once I added Sriracha to it  it tasted way better  but I shouldn't have to add that for it to taste good. This place looks like it should be in the food court in the mall. We know the quality there.
label: Complaint

review: The pasta here is just aggressively mediocre. We were really excited because of how great the pictures were  but it genuinely was just "ok". Paying $18 for mediocre pasta is a huge letdown. I got the penne a la vodka  and it lacked any flavor at all. Watered down  salt less  I had to bury the dish in pepper and red pepper to taste anything at all. We also got a spaghetti  and the noodles were over cooked and the sauce tasted very odd  almost earthy? Overall  I'm really disappointed with the food. Our waitress was very kind though!
label: Complaint

review: I phoned the order in and was told food would be ready in 16 mins. We arrived about 20 mins later and the pizza was not even in the oven. Had to wait about another 25 mins. The wings were very good but the sauce on the pizza is a sweeter taste than we were used to but also had a spicy bite. I would not recommend this restaurant.
label: Complaint

review: So sad. I grew up in south STL and the Imo's out there and back then was the place to go. The pizzas  the meatball sandwich and hot roast beef..all fire. This location and overall the brand of Imo's has deteriorated so much over the years. I hate to say this  but STL Pizza and Wings is so much better and way more reasonable on price. Sorry Imo's. You're nit the same anymore.
label: Complaint

review: I just stopped in to Homage for a chai latte. I haven't been there in years  but I like supporting local  and I was in the neighborhood. Sadly  it was one of the weakest chai teas I've ever had. Little flavor  no spice added  and not as hot as I would like on this chilly morning. Their pastries looked amazing  there were quite a few people seated inside  and the staff was pleasant. Disappointed with my "spiced" chai tea.
label: Complaint

review: We went to Nunzio's for a date night  but unfortunately we had to wait over an hour for our food when there were many tables still open. The food is great  but the lack of awareness from our server and the wait time for the food was not worth it.
label: Complaint

review: I wanted this to be a place for me to frequent like Floras down the street. Nope. It's expensive. Don't get me wrong  I will PAY for a good dinner  but I went in to get dinner and I paid $18 for a salad. It was dinner. It was $18. I expected a dinner-salad. What I got was a pre-entre salad that did not stand up to the $18 price tag. A similar salad found at Wildflower for instance is $10. And that salad  I went wow  this is good! Tucson is a City of gastronomy--https://tucson.cityofgastronomy.org/about-- so there are a lot of quality dining options out there. I don't think this place will fare well with the $$$ price tag and the lack of quantity and quality of their food. If your staying at the Doubletree  venture out  Tucson has WAY more better options. Also  had our waitress not treated us like I was bothering her during our interactions  I would have been happy to tell her my thoughts in person instead of here...
label: Complaint

review: We arrived before 6 on a Thursday evening and were quickly seated inside. Our meals were okay; nothing to highly recommend but big portions. However it was SO crowded and SO loud that we couldn't wait to get out of there! Not recommended
label: Complaint

review: Oh boy. So I paid $40 for 2 burgers an order of fries. The burgers were not special. I think I let a little tear go when I signed the check.
label: Complaint

review: Had high hopes  but very overpriced ramen for the quality and quantity. If I'm going to pay nearly $20 for a bowl I expect it to be top of the line and this place has dissapointed me every time :(
label: Complaint

review: Overall  we weren't impressed whatsoever. We placed our order online and we're hopeful for large portions given our extremely high ticket price. We got a few choices of meats and 5 different sides. The meat...pulled pork was incredibly dry. Like was this left over from the weekend? The beef brisket... it came in a round container which concerned me..when I opened it  imagine pulled pot roast. Zero smoke flavor and dry beyond our preference. My wife was looking forward to good brisket only to be very disappointed. The smoked sausage  best thing we tried but small portioned for what we were charged. The sides...oh the sides. Why is everyone afraid of seasoning? Literally where is the salt and pepper at least? Mac and cheese  boxed flavor. Green beans  bland. Slaw  blah. Baked beans  tasted like beans with a bottle of bbq sauce squeezed into them. Brunswick stew was like eating leftover stew that someone tried to spice up with more bbq sauce. Will we be back? Maybe. Recommend to friends  no. Worth the price you pay  absolutely not.
label: Complaint

review: Confusing menu  food isn't much to write home about. I've had a lot of sushi but would rate this sushi as disappointing. It's not bad by any means  just not worth your time when there are better options nearby. The portions were generous  however.
label: Complaint

review: Three years after my earlier review  and nothing seems to have improved. This time I skipped the 'meat and three'  and decided to see how they would do with that 'All-American' favorite  the cheeseburger and fries. First  the good part. The french fries  even though they were obviously previously frozen  were excellent. They were served hot  slightly crisp on the outside  perfectly done on the inside. But the sad part was that the burger wasn't as good as any you could get at the fast food joints just off the Interstate. Disecting it  patty looked fresh  but was completely devoid of flavor. Apparently they didn't even have salt or pepper. One last comment: the coffee was just dreadful. It tasted like they used whatever they could get at the lowest possible price. C'mon folks. At least try to get the coffee right.
label: Complaint

review: I understand making mistakes with a sandwich but I would bet money that both employees were high as a kite when my daughter and I came in today. Ingredients were added to a sandwich that were never mentioned  others that were requested were left off completely  and I've never seen someone make a sandwich so slowly. Don't go to work high  kids. Customers can definitely tell even if you think they can't.
label: Complaint

review: Did the 'when in Philly  get a Philly cheesesteak' thing. Hate to say it  don't love Genos. First time I had a cheesesteak with sliced meat instead of shredded. Also the last time I will have a cheesesteak with sliced meat instead to shredded. What an odd concept. I will say the employees were kind and extremely fast at getting the food out so kudos to them. The cheesesteak was so basic. Just a slice of cheese  thick slices of tomatoes  a ton of onions  and let's hear it  sliced meat. Wish it was more cut up and mixed around and blended together but I suppose when you are Genos  quantity is more important than quality.
label: Complaint

review: Cute atmosphere  food is not very good. Idk why this place has so many stars. Salad was SO over dressed I couldn't even eat any of it. Chicken is that disgusting chewy chicken you dread getting served. Skip
label: Complaint

review: I want to like this place... But the service and staff just kind of suck... Honestly they could seem to care less on the product they put out... I don't think I've had a hot taco yet... Which is sad because I think of many of them could be better if they were served fresher and with a little care... honestly Del taco and Taco Bell serve warmer fresher and better put together tacos and we've all seen what they look like...The beans with the green stuff in them I don't know what that is but it's not Mexican food... Not even edible to me Imho
label: Complaint

review: Came early on New Years Eve. Waitress was fantastic. Food was pretty subpar. For some reason the hostess felt the need to correct my husband of 36 years on who should go first. Crazy
label: Complaint

review: Live music was great. That's all I can say because I sat here for an hour without being helped. Finally caved and got a drink from the bar. Came for the 'free sunset shooter' that never happened.
label: Complaint

review: Usually always happy with the seafood trio. This time not so much. Very skimpy on the seafood  barely a octopus leg if reconstructed. A few shrimps and a few scallops. Very sad. They piled in the sides to fill the plate. I understand prices have gone up but this was very disappointing.
label: Complaint

review: I'm really disappointed in Shokku Ramen. When a ramen place opened up so near my home AND they promised to have Miracle Noodles on the menu (I would have been fine with any gluten-free noodle but I was especially excited to try those)  I was so thrilled. I went one time early last summer (before I became more seriously gluten free out of medical necessity) and was told after an incredibly long wait that they were 'working on their staffing issues' and that they would have the noodles 'soon.' It's been over six months  yet the company is still saying the same thing about staff and the noodles have been taken off the menu altogether for a few months now. Thoroughly annoyed with their lack of inclination to make actual changes... especially in a neighborhood like Hillsboro Village. What a letdown.
label: Complaint

review: Let me start by saying Central Taco & Tequila is a nice  stylish  well lit and clean restaurant with a very nice staff. If you're looking for Mexican-ish or Mexican-style food then you will LOVE this establishment. However  my girlfriend and I were under the impression that we would be eating actual Mexican food and that was were things fell apart. Putting beans  rice and meat in a tortilla may add up to 'Mexican food' on paper  but I can say with absolute certainty that there is not one Mexican chef  owner or other employee that is involved with making this food. Eating here is like doing Taco Tuesday over your white best friends parents house in middle school. I'm quite confident our burritos were from an El Paso kit found in the 'ethnic aisle' at Shop Rite. The guacamole tasted like it was squeezed from a plastic package. If it were made on the premises I'm not sure if that would be better or worse. It just had no flavor and no soul. If you're dropping in for a drink on happy hour  they have some nice beers and tequila flights  but if you want Mexican food  an assembly line Chipotle burrito feels infinitely more autenticó. If for strange reason the Cartel came to Haddon Township and had to eat this food  they would almost certainly dismember anyone involved with making it. Two stars.
label: Complaint

review: We were not pleased at all. The biscuits were small and hard. The glaze was ok  but where was the cinnamon? I especially wanted to try them because I heard good things. When my hubby walked in to pick up our order  ( I had called ahead!) they weren't ready and the young man just grabbed them  poured the glaze over them and that was that! It was 90 min before closing time  but they were in a rush to close! Not sure if we'll try them again!
label: Complaint

review: We have been to Sunset Sushi on numerous occasions. Normally the food and service is good. The past two occasions were terrible. Tonight we arrived at 5:15 and were the first people seated. We promptly ordered. It took over a hour to get our food. We saw other people get up and leave. At a minimum the management should have taken something off the bill. Will not be back.
label: Complaint

review: Interestingly we've been here a few times  normally one of our stops for dinner while in town  however  this time was absolutely not great. Bland over cooked food  poor service  and sub par in general  not a good look for the most expensive steak house open with expectations of such. When the waiter clears you plate still full of food and fails to even ask if everything was ok  tells me they don't care. This will more than likely be my last visit to Luckys  there are just too many restaurants that are doing good things to pay supremely overpriced fares for lackluster food
label: Complaint

review: I was so excited to try this place in Reading Terminal as I had heard rave reviews and saw the line wrapping around the shop. Sadly the food did not live up to the hype. I got the classic roast pork sandwich they are known for. The pork itself was dry and not juicy enough  The broccoli rabe added a slight mustardy taste that did not complement the rest of the sandwich. Overall  it was just an okay sandwich. I found it quite bland and it definitely could've used more sauce or something to add flavor.
label: Complaint

review: I won't name the server by name but he needs more training! He was nice but NEEDS more training! Place wasn't even half full. 8pm. He had 2 tables. 3 total people to help. I asked for water 3x. Asked for green tea. Never got it. Never got water either. Got the water from someone else. 20 mins later he asks if he can get me anything else. I say some water please! Told him he forgot the tea. He was nice about it but left it on the bill. He took it off. Left me with no pen for 10 more mins. Ugh!!! Train him! You pay for the food AND the experience. Make it better. --Sushi was good. Calamari was way different than in the menu. (See photos)
label: Complaint

review: Food is ok but has no spice or real flavor. It is obviously catering to a specific type of white person that lives in this area. Bland flavorless food with mediocre service. Depending on the day you will find the staff less than friendly. We all have bad days but it seems they're just bitchy a lot. Definitely don't consider this Mexican food but more of a white man's TexMex.
label: Complaint

review: The location is great. The build is new and nice. The signage is eye catching and bring people in. The decor is typical. The photos of the family traveling is a neat idea. The menu has a good variety. Food is definitely Americanized. The food is just average. The chips and salsa are extra and the guacamole seemed a little over priced but I'm not sure how much avocados cost in Idaho. The actual meals were just okay. I have eaten here twice now and not impressed. The kitchen sink burrito was not good. Unfortunately it tasted just like it's name. Sounds mean but my 13 year old cooks better than that. It was busy on the inside and was difficult to find a table. There was a super large group that had no common courtesy and acted like they were the only people in the world. They had already finished and were just hanging out and talking. They had no responsibility for their kids and they were running around inside like it was a playground. This part was not really in control of the business but they could have maybe mentioned for them to leave when completing their meal so others who had ordered could sit down and enjoy their meal. And to not let their kids run around bothering others. I have a family four kids but would never let them be disrespectful to others and behave in such a manner.
label: Complaint

review: The place went completely downhill after Covid. The ingredients are not the same. They no longer have the Red Fish. The menu doesn't have much on it as they use to. I won't be going here anymore
label: Complaint

review: Visiting from out of the area. Soup du jour was cauliflower scallop. Delicious! Except there was no detectable cauliflower. Tasted like cream of mushroom with some scallops thrown in. Entree was medallions of veal with potatoes Anna. Veg was a mixture of tomatoes  mushrooms & kale. Veal was poorly trimmed...raggedy hunk hanging off one  fat blob on another. And  sadly  overcooked and a bit tough. The potatoes & veg were poorly seasoned. No detectable salt in one bite  overwhelming amounts in the next. The potatoes were dry as a bone. Dessert was the Grand Mariner soufflé. Beautifully baked and looked wonderful. Horribly sweet and a total miss. Wouldn't recommend and would never go back. Service wasn't great either. Very long waits  no offer of coffee or a second glass of wine and we had to push our dishes across the table to hint they they needed picking up.
label: Complaint

review: I wanted to like this place. I was following them for a long time on instagram and finally had time to go in. I thought the ambiance was alright. Very tight space and does need a deep clean. The food was very mid. Too much frozen stuff for me.
label: Complaint

review: We ordered food for delivery. It took 2-1/2 hours to get delivered. I've ordered from here for the past 6 years. Not even a phone to let me know what's going on. I even called and she said they were backed up. I asked if my order had even been out for delivery yet. This 1-1/2 after my order. She said she didn't know.
label: Complaint

review: ordered pick up with door dash my gravy was liquid not thick at all. The rest of the food does look good though.
label: Complaint

review: You guys got rid of a lot of great things on the menu. I was very disappointed when I could not order the beef stroganoff or even pizza. Only ordered drinks and then left. This used to be a go to place but not anymore.
label: Complaint

review: Service was great  but the food was meh. I ordered the Western omelette and the onion and peppers were kind of raw. The pancakes my partner ordered upset both of our stomachs (either that or it was the water). Utensils were also a little dirty. Standard diner with room for improvement. The server was wearing a face mask the entire time  and the booths are distanced/separated  which we appreciated
label: Complaint

review: We select Pearl based on a local. Allowing for slower service  most restaurants are short staffed  we still found service lacking. Apps came with no one to check on us  and we ordered salads with dressing on the side  not an unreasonable request for an upscale restaurant.- Salad came drenched in dressing and two upcharge Caesar's came with tired brown lettuce (sent back). The fish special was OK  but a very small portion and at $52.00 disappointing. My daughter ordered seafood pasta which had a decidedly strong unpleasant aroma  not sure if was the spice or fish. Overall dinner for four with 2 glasses of wine was about $300.... we are not going back.
label: Complaint

review: Placed our order through Grubhub at 6 pm on a Friday for 1 pasta dish and 1 pizza. Estimated 45-50 min wait time. After 45 mins  got a notice that they accidentally gave our order to someone else. Mistakes happen. But it took another 50 minutes for them to remake and deliver our order. Disappointing that we didn't get our order prioritized (shouldn't take 50 mins to make 1 pizza and 1 pasta dish and deliver it 7 minutes away). When I called to ask about the long wait and check on my order (1.5 hours after I placed my order)  I was told they only had 2 hostesses instead of 3 working that night. While it did sound busy in the restaurant  it shouldn't take 3 hostesses to ensure the right orders are picked up  nor do hostesses make the actual food or prioritize the orders. When then food did arrive  the pizza was cold and lacking in flavor. The pasta was warm but also lacking in overall flavor. Order local (Bar Sera  Bar Luca  Pepperoncini's in Conshy or Pietro's in Radnor) for better service and quality. Management needs to step up the game if they want their chain to compete with other options in the area with food that is as good or better and with better service. This could be the outlier but we won't be ordering again.
label: Complaint

review: Ok  so I only way the ravioli sometimes I get some fries Now there's this new thing you can only order online   here's the thing ONLINE YOU MUST SIGN INTO TO SOME ACCOUNTS  and everything you want is NOT even there to order .. for example (plain fries/ small salad/house salad).. it's realllll hard to give my money to them at this point .. and you can just give up trying to get someone on the phone because that's not going to happen .. whoever's idea this only online thingy was must not have been thinking AT ALL that day ..
label: Complaint

review: I don't hate it here  but I definitely don't love it. Came in on a Friday lunch and the place was dead. Took about 20 minutes just to get some rum drink with an extra "floater" that tasted like straight cranberry juice and sugar. Opted to get a beer flight after 2 sips of my drink. Beer flight was good  okay selection of beers. We ordered a crab rangoon dip as an appetizer and felt like we were just eating warmed cream cheese - NOTHING close to those delicious pockets of crabby goodness you'd normally get! The 2 things this place has going for it are the open air concept on both floors and their lobster roll. Lobster was fresh and plentiful on the roll. Good taste and perfect size!
label: Complaint

review: When you order pad Thai  you might expect a peanut sauce and that traditional dish you get from a Thai restaurant  but that's not what Thai Kitchen will serve you. It's a bit more of a sweet teriyaki thing. Pretty over seasoned so by the time you get to the bottom  it's a little much. Kind of gut bomb-y. Can't say I'd go back  but I think the college crowd loves it.
label: Complaint

review: Currently sitting in the drive thru...24 minutes the longest wait ever! The van in front of us took up 15 minutes ordering  meanwhile in the right lane 4 cars already went thru. The difference between this visit and others  there is no one out there taking orders. Never again.
label: Complaint

review: Located at the end of B Terminal  social distancing seems to be a thing of the past  all customers shoved on one side of the restaurant. Only breakfast at 10:30a. Bland shrimp and grits. Wait staff seems bored and unfamiliar with "If you can lean  you can clean". But you are trapped. Metaphorically.
label: Complaint

review: I'll be honest  I'm not a fan of the chain. There's better local options here in Nashville. I haven't been to a PF Chang's in easily a decade but we met another couple here at their request to have dinner. The Mu Shoo Chicken is no longer in the menu which is what I ordered so I opted for the pad Thai chicken and was left disappointed as there was zero flavor to it. Go to Deg Thai or Smiling Elephant or Soy Bistro if you want actually great food cooked well with flavor and seasoned. The wait was long even with a reservation  as we got seated a half hour after our call ahead time and the service was okay at best. Next time we'll recommend going to our local faves when meeting these friends rather than waste our time and money with lackluster food.
label: Complaint

review: On my quest to find a good liver dish with nice wine in Philly  I ventured to Jake's. Upon entering  I was calmed by the dim(ish) lights  warm colored walls  and low music. A relaxed but semi-fancy atmosphere  depending on where you'd sit. The Boudreaux wine we ordered was quite delectable- dry  not too sweet  and a woodsy aftertaste- however  that was the end of my meal's delight. The "calve" (it's calf!) liver I ordered medium was well-done with no pink  and was served atop an apple potato salad you would get made by your aunt that can't cook at a family picnic. I get they were trying to be clever - liver and "caramelized" onions (which had 0 flavor  barely cooked  and caramelized onions are usually my favorite salty topping to ANY savory dish) with apple - but the flavors mixed together sabotaged each other. On their own  each was not too shabby. Additionally  the portobello mushroom soup was nothing to call home about - it reminded me of the Campell's can of cream of mushroom soup your parents would force you to eat as a kid. My boyfriend's slow-cooked pork was the best (and only) amazing item I tried that night- for the prices (30$ for a sub-par liver and the equivalent of one small white potato) I think this place is overrated  and would call this diner quality food (no offense to diners) at a romantic atmosphere restaurant.
label: Complaint

review: It was okay. We made a reservation for a Monday which was totally unnecessary but it is what it is. The menu online did not reflect the menu in the restaurant but we were fine with that. We decided to get fried alligator as an app (free with a Yelp check-in!) and it was super chewy with too much breading. For my entree I had the crawfish pasta. The entree was very good but could have used more crawfish. Our drinks were very weak. Our waiter was disengaged. The manager who helped with the free app was nice. The hostess wanted to be anywhere but there. Still giving three stars because it's still a pandemic yada yada.
label: Complaint

review: After visiting a handful of times over the past year or so I would put edison at 3.5 stars (rounding down to 3 due to the pricing). The service is consistently very good and the creativity is commendable but something about the food always leaves me wanting. I read the menu and am always intrigued and excited by the combinations but then the food comes and it feels like something is missing. After the 20+ dishes I have tried I can say that nothing has ever been "bad" (no small feat given some of the combinations they pull off)  but also nothing has ever been DELICIOUS. At the end of the day the day the dishes are more memorable on the page than on the palate. Will be interesting to see what Michelin makes of edison later this year. Lastly  I'll say that the price increases are obscene. Some dishes have nearly doubled in price since our first visit. The food is simply not good enough  nor generous enough to justify the current price. After our most recent visit  our group went for burgers given we were still hungry and not willing to spend $100 per person at dinner. I'm sympathetic to food costs  supply chain  labor costs etc. however we regularly eat out at other leading restaurants in the area and have not had this experience anywhere else. I hope they can figure out their sourcing.
label: Complaint

review: I always enjoy the food  but every time I go to get food the guy behind the counter never responds or communicates and just walks away. You don't see him again until he brings you your food. Even when ordering to go  it'd be nice to know if it's going to be a few more minutes before it's ready  rather than retreating to the kitchen without any info. It's a small thing that makes a BIG difference.
label: Complaint

review: The salads are excellent crisp and large. The pizza however is always undercooked and soggy at the center. The toppings are incredibly abundant a result of too much sauce and if ordering anything with vegetable topping the same issue is even worse. Be prepared to pop the pizza on to your own preheated oven pizza stone and bake a bit more which helps. Or perhaps recook each slice in a non stick pan. Regrettably this is the problem which is a shame. Never ordered anything else beyond salad and pizza. In person service is hyper to order and takes a normal time to bring out. The and the staff are loud and live in their own world with annoying music and shenanigans. They are oblivious to how weird they come across.
label: Complaint

review: Run of the mill diner. Nice place to stop by for a late-night dinner as it is open 24 hours. The food is just okay  but that is to be expected. Our waitress was nice.
label: Neutral

review: DELICIOUS FOOD!!! It's a Tucson Gem. Truly one of the last few great spots to get authentic food. I like the sushi however I sat at the bar once (I've been going here for years) and I really lost my appetite after seeing the way the sushi chefs were not sanitary at all. I also noticed one of the sushi chefs go to the bathroom with his gloves on and walked out with them on and still went straight back to work. I was in shock and ended up ordering Ramen instead. The SERVICE though is truly wonderful. The ladies who are waitresses are fantastic.
label: Complaint

review: From the music to the Aloha greetings when you walk in  they really attempt to give you a Hawaiian vibe in the restaurant and I'll give them credit for that. Unfortunately  the sushi isn't that great. I've lived in Hawaii so I know good fish and this just isn't it. I don't even think it's as good as some that I've had on the mainland. It's worth a try  but don't be surprised if you're disappointed.
label: Complaint

review: Let me start by saying that everyone from the hostess to the waiter were amazing  I just wish the food was as great as the staff. The Gumbo was lacking in substance and flavor. The jambalaya was could and the rice was over cooked and mushy. The Red Beans were Amazing! The cocktail was fun but weak.
label: Complaint

review: Very friendly service  but took quite a while for the food to come out. Food was ok (chile relleno). The ice tea was bad. The water used had a bad flavor and overpowered the tea. Small setting and the couple next to us didn't know a vocabulary beyond the f word. Not the restaurant's fault  but certainly interfered with our meal. Not sure I'll return.
label: Complaint

review: The food and service on New Year's Eve was excellent. That said  we paid much more than we expected to pay for dinner  partially because we didn't get a text telling us about the special menu and $124 per person for New Year's Eve because my husband's cell phone had been stolen. I did receive a reminder email from Yelp on 12/29 but it reinforced the $49 meal price. Since the price included wine pairings  it wasn't unreasonable. But my husband doesn't like wine so we probably would have cancelled had we known. While the problem with the text wasn't the restaurant's fault  I do have an issue with the 20 percent ($50) Fourking Fee we were charged on top of the 20 percent tip. There was no mention of this extra fee anywhere I can find in the text or on the website. All-in-all  two dinners with wine and a beer cost $379.
label: Complaint

review: Our food order was deserving of five stars. My husband ordered the Pad Thai (his favorite) and I had the chicken fried rice. Both were served piping hot and full of flavor. Our service though was INTENSE. Our waitress had zero patience as we placed our order  although we knew what we wanted to order she was walking away as we were still explaining the specifics of our order. She did this again when we had a request for condiments. She wouldn't slow down long enough to listen to us and by the time she returned with what we needed  we were finished eating and looking for our bill. This is truly one of our favorite places to eat  I just hope we never get this server again.
label: Complaint

review: Drink selection here is probably a 4/5 but so/so quality bar food with an exceptionally long wait every time I'm here lately. The turnaround times for entrees is also insanely long and on more than one occasion I've had subpar attitudes from waiters here. The beer variety is their truly redeeming quality and they do a good job sourcing from local brewers!
label: Complaint

review: The bar is Christmas themed. I got the Grinch shot and another drink in a Santa boot. Paid about 35-40 bucks for both and that's including the tip I added for the bartender. Both drinks were very sweet not enough to get you tipsy. If you're looking for a fun place to meet your friends to start the night Tinsel is it. The staff was friendly and the holiday chair was the perfect instagram photo spot. If you're worried about Covid no one wears masks inside. It's very crowded on the weekend and they do check to confirm everyone has been vaccinated. Better late than never but happy holidays.
label: Neutral

review: I heard about this historic place that you HAVE to eat at if you visit New Orleans  so we came. The atmosphere and nostalgia behind this place is what earned it the 3 stars. The food was nothing special or anything that made the hype worth it. It's your average southern food joint. I was prepared to have my eyes rolling in the back of head after the first bite  but that wasn't the case. By no means was it nasty  it just wasn't delicious. If you're going to visit  do so  but don't be expect to have your taste buds blown away.
label: Complaint

review: We came in for dinner during a snow storm and when we were there we saw a fun band play some bluegrass music and they were very good. The restaurant got very busy once the band started playing and the place is small so it was a bit loud. We ordered the sweet potato hush puppies  which were pretty good  and we had the half chicken and burger for dinner. The chicken was good but it came with croutons and cold tomatoes for the "vegetable" so we had to order another item due to the plate being quite small. The chicken was good but it was a little expensive for what we got.
label: Complaint

review: Started price gouging! I've been eating here for at least a decade. Prices have always been fair and Gyros are great. Inflation sucks and is a part of life in 2022...but Gyroshack got greedy. 36% increase. Sorry  you'll need to resolve your business model as I'm not paying $8 for a Gyro...no other fast food has gone up 36%  you're being greedy. Ironically as other reviews have mentioned  they don't even pay their employees enough ($7.50) to eat at their own restaurant! When you're driving slave labor and implementing massive price increases you know this establishment has jumped the shark. Interesting to hear they have fairly new ownership...go figure.
label: Complaint

review: This was more like 2.5 stars but I rounded up for the fries. I saw this on Uber Eats and this is right around where we live so I thought I would give it a try. Ordered the Philly cheesesteak for my husband and I got the Dagwood. The wheat bread was over toasted and dried out. Meat was not a substantial enough amount. Condiments and toppings were actually good and fresh. The fact that they have fresh cut fries was nice because sometimes you just don't want chips. Probably wouldn't go back.
label: Complaint

review: First time and was excited to try THE CAFE DU MONDE beignets. However  when we arrived the line wrapped around. We had to wait 30+ minutes in the cold before we can place our order. Keep in mind that this location accepts cash only. The tables and chairs are not really cleaned throughout after people leave so beware. We order one order of the beignets which comes with 3 pieces. When we open the bag  the beignets looks disappointing and not the puffy cloud beignets it was supposed to be. It looks just like random blobs. However  it taste amazing! Please keep in mind that there are many locations of Cafe Du Monde in NOLA so I would recommend checking the other locations if you don't mind not going to the original location.
label: Complaint

review: Went one night for a quick bite and drinks! Wings were amazing! Like really good. Also for a burger off HH menu. Was supposed to come with lettuce and tomato and had no tomato. Asked to be cooked medium and came out Med well to well done. All in all...go for the wings.
label: Complaint

review: Came on a weekday for lunch around 11:30AM  not too crowded  private parking lot in the back  has outdoor seating. Got the Tuck Special  didn't realize it didn't come with sides and is a sandwich. Flavor was quite delicious from the pimento cheese and sauce  but the brisket wasn't anything special. It was a bit hard and not flavorful at all  and I added a bunch of the BBQ sauce on the table to it. Mac and cheese was a bit sweet or something  somewhat odd. Really liked the grits though!
label: Complaint

review: Kind of a major tourist trap here but you gotta have a cheesesteak when in Philly. Located near the Ben Franklin museum  this was very quick and easy after a long morning of museums. Lots of options on the cheese so take a step back and really take a look at the menu. Ordering felt a little rushed. We had the classic cheesesteak. Wished we mixed it up a little. The fries were fresh. If I could have just had a beer with it  it would have been perfect!
label: Neutral

review: We sat outdoors  and I have to say  the setting is wonderful. Right in the middle of all the action  with the glorious St. Pete waterfront right across the way. Our server Chase was charming and attentive. The smoked salmon sandwich was out of this world. But the shrimp po'boy was such a disappointment. It's not a po'boy if it is not on a French roll  and this was on a ciabatta roll and a stale one at that. Inexcusable. We travel all over the country and it really is hard to find a great mid-priced restaurant. I had high hopes for this place but no  it fell short. We had to wait 20 or 30 min for a table and we saw several empty  unbussed tables. It was okay  we walked around the park in the sunshine and with every business short-handed these days I really can't hold that against them.
label: Complaint

review: Ok disclaimer that this review may be unpopular but it is my opinion only. We were staying in the area and had heard about this bakery which was known for some great breakfast sandwich items so we stopped by. We ordered the breakfast sandwich and the crispy chicken sandwich. Breakfast sandwich: 3/5 Reading the reviews I was excited to try it. As the reviews mention the egg is perfectly soft. What I found lacking was any flavor. The brioche bread was not as buttery or sweet as others I have had and I was just expecting more. Chicken sandwich: 4/5 After taking my first bite I was underwhelmed but realized what the problem was. The bacon is too chewy and distracts from the perfectly crisp on the outside and tender on the inside chicken. So I removed the bacon and took my second bite and loved the sandwich. I would order the chicken sandwich with the bacon on the side. I wish the bacon pieces were thinner and crispier.
label: Suggestion

review: Love me some Oscar's. But  if you're going to offer breakfast burritos in the menu  maybe be open during breakfast hours?
label: Suggestion

review: The food and drinks here are solid  but the wait time for food was obscene. Our reservation was on a Friday night at 7:15pm. The appetizers and drinks came out reasonably quickly  but did not get our entrees until closer to 9:30pm  maybe an hour and a half after appetizers came.
label: Complaint

review: I'm torn on this place - we were really hoping for a great experience. Our waiter was wonderful. Very attentive and one of the only reasons we would give another try. Steak was very very underwhelming and not cooked to the right temperature. Fish dish was just meh. The bill was crazy expensive for such subpar food  but I just can't help thinking we should try just one more time. First experience definitely missed the mark on the food.
label: Complaint

review: The food was good and the service was adequate if not slow. The Prosecco  beet and citrus terrine  and crème brûlée was great and we should have stopped there. We spent more time waiting for food  to take orders  and the bill than we did eating and drinking. When a plate of food is served  the protein should face the diner so they don't have to use their napkin to turn around a screaming hot plate in order to eat their food. We ordered Prosecco and the menu (with wine list) was taken. We eventually asked another waiter for a wine list and apparently the fact it was on the table again wasn't hint enough. But then we never saw our waiter again before another server delivered the food. Apparently wine was not an option for us. Hint: we wanted wine. Did I not realize it's a self serve joint? We were seated immediately next to the entrance of the outdoor seating area (very nice)  where apparently 3-4 servers decide to hang out while while waiting for something to do. While all seemed very nice  not exactly great ambiance compared to others who were seated further down  and frankly  seemed to get more attention. Three scallops  mashed potato's and asparagus for $45 seems a bit overpriced even in this area and at that service level is a really disappointing. We finally asked for the bill so we could get up and leave.
label: Complaint

review: The restaurant has a nice atmosphere  nice & fancy set up. Parking is ok  the area gets crowded but if you're patient you'll get a parking space. Service was decent  despite us being place way back of the restaurant. Everyone but me enjoyed their food. I'm not sure I'll be back.
label: Neutral

review: Can be a little hit or miss  but you definitely need to eat in here rather than get takeout. The vibes are great and the beer selection is awesome
label: Neutral

review: Well gotta say this was my first trip in and I wasn't overly thrilled I ordered a large burrito the pork verde one while it was big and hot there wasn't much meat in it the flavor of the meat was also bland it was nearly all rice past that I'd give it maybe 4 out of 10. Service was quick though...
label: Complaint

review: Ate here about a week ago. Our server was great and very attentive. My hubby and I ordered the beef fajitas. I only got 3 small one inch pieces of lettuce and small amount of pico. The guac was fantastic as it has been in prior visits. The steak was cooked well  but over seasoned. Limited menu compared to the past and beer selections very limited.
label: Complaint

review: We happened upon Blanco Cocina + Cantina on December 30th 2021... and I'm so glad we did. We were in town to watch our Purdue Boilermakers take on the Tennessee Volunteers in the Music City Bowl. It was a beautiful day  and we needed to fuel-up before the big game. This attractive restaurant is right on Broadway. I would not call this an authentic Mexican restaurant; but rather an upscale  Americanized  Mexican restaurant. Our waiter was very nice  and hustled his butt off. He mentioned they are known for their Short Rib Machaca meat. I ordered The Tucson Chimichanga with ... (you guessed it) Short Rib Machaca. It had good flavor but the meat was a little too mushy. It came with rice and beans. I loved the rice! My wife had The Little Gem Caesar salad with steak. It was tasty. This is a solid restaurant. I'm not sure when I'll be in Nashville again  but I'll definitely keep this place in mind!
label: Neutral

review: The food here is good  but the guy who is usually here running the register is not friendly and to be honest  it limits my ability to enjoy the food. Recently  for several months a friendly woman ran the register and my wife and I began to frequent this establishment more often. Today we discovered that the guy is back.... So likely we will decrease our visits again as a result. Maybe we will just do a drive by to see who is running the register. Maybe we will just go elsewhere.
label: Complaint

review: Food was good  but bar service/takeout process needs improvement. The kitchen was pounding orders out and I saw bags & boxes sitting without being delivered for take outs. The gentleman next to me goes 4 nights a week and wasn't even offered water while he sat at the bar waiting to be served; he left and I waited 45 min for my order which was cold by the time I got home. Was disappointing. In their defense  it was a wicked busy night  and  I only went once. There were a bunch of regulars which speaks loudly to their core customers devotion to restaurant.
label: Complaint

review: 3.5/5 This was our first time ordering and unfortunately we weren't blown away like the other reviews said we would be. I got the besties 2: chicken and pork with Mac n cheese Hubs got the pulled pork sandwich with beans. We both agreed the best part of the meal was the bbq sauces! That bestie sauce I don't regret trying this while in town  but we preferred pappy's.
label: Complaint

review: Have been there before & really enjoyed it  but this time the sauce was tasty on the boil but almost completely oil! Also there was a lot of in the shell crawdads. They only have a bite of meat in the tail. Not a very good value for the price. We ordered the Black Pearl. Also  even though we had 4 adults and a 2yo with an 11 yo  only the 4 adults ordered food and the kids ordered drinks  we were automatically billed an 18% tip so our bill came to approx. $228.00. An expensive lunch!
label: Complaint

review: I had the chicken fried steak special. The steak was over cooked and dry. The gravy was bland. The hash browns were old and not hot. All this for 15$. There are better breakfast spots.
label: Complaint

review: Great atmosphere and sat outside on deck. $16 for bread and salad and meal and dessert for that price on lunch menu. Scallops were wonderful. I would not recommend the meatloaf as it was "mushy". Overall great place and good service.
label: Neutral

review: Got a vanilla iced latte with oat milk  a chai tea late  and a caramel brûlée latte. They gave me an extremely small cup for the latte and it was still about $4. The cups were also sticky.
label: Complaint

review: This used to be a pizza place I can count on for whenever I crave for pizza. Sadly this time my experience was subpar. Garlic bread was mostly bread with hints of garlic and the margarita pizza had a burnt base. Everything tasted average at best. Gonna have to hunt for a new place. :(
label: Complaint

review: Let's get right to the point: this place is an ugly twin of Panda Express; it's identical with pricing and food options  but the quality is slightly lower. I think Panda Express is God's gift to mankind  so I thought this place was average. However  I realize any normal person would have probably throw up  and so I am reluctant to give 3 stars  but it's because there can be only one greasy-unauthentic-Asian-running-to-the-bathroom establishment  and that's Panda Express.
label: Complaint

review: Always good food but came in tonight with my family only to be told the dining room was closed. We ate in the car but a sign posted at the door would've been a good idea. Many customers were irritated.
label: Complaint

review: L O C A T I O N ! On recommendation from my daughter who had visited Clearwater Beach  and an old high school friend who lives nearby  we had lunch here. On vacation Minnesota  any seafood was appealing! Crab & Shrimp Chowder. 4 stars Grouper Cheeks. 4 stars Chicken Nachos. 3 stars The Grouper Cheeks were SO DELICIOUS  but I ate too many. Tummy ache  my bad. Chowder  very Floridian. Nachos  near impossible to get from plate to mouth. Our server was a pleasant gal  Julia  but the outstanding feature was the sea view. A little too chilly to have our lunch on the deck  but we were seated by the window. Mesmerizing! Add the guitars with the live music  and a memorable lunch was had. But then the bill arrived  I was astounded by how overpriced it was. Guess that's the amenities price  but all the other restaurants in the area are not that over priced. Just an FYI. O V E R P R I C E D BY A M I L E !
label: Complaint

review: My pizza joint mission is on a roll  visiting places that serve slices and this was on my list. It was around two in the afternoon and it was time to get a couple slices. Counter service like all real pizza joints and I guess because of covid  there was no indoor seating nor outdoors  this was no concern to me. I ordered the two slice deal and sat in the shade by my car. I will say this  the crust was thin crispy and perfectly done. However  I will say this  they use a lower quality cheese and perhaps too much. Yea  I know  too much cheese? With too much low quality cheese I really couldn't get a take on the sauce. My recommendation to the owner would be get a better cheese  use less and it could be a four start pizza. Since this section of 4th Street don't have any other pizza by the slice  please stop in and let me know what you think.
label: Suggestion

review: Cool ambiance. Food was OK. I ordered the Sausage Risotto and my husband got the wagyu steak. He commented that he's had better steak for a lot less price. The Risotto was fine but I feel like there are probably better meals on the menu. I'd consider going back and trying something else. The service was kind of slow but it didnt bother me too much because it let me slow down and take in the night. But heed the warning if you have firm plans after dinner; give yourself more time. They have a piano man with table service on the piano. I'd love to do that sometime!
label: Neutral

review: My partner had the Parma Hash which he enjoyed very much. I had the Classic Eggs Benedict which was okay but not great. Was lukewarm  possibly because of the cold tomato that was part of the dish. Service was perfunctory.
label: Complaint

review: Only giving this place a 3 star rating because the manager made up for all the mistakes with mu hubby's meal by comping our whole meal! My husband ordered eggs benedict with the eggs poached hard ( he doesn't like runny yolk ) First order  the eggs were totally runny! Sent it back  the second time  they had very little sauce! So he asked just for some more sauce & they said no we'll have them make it again  took forever! He waited about 45 mins! I was done with mine by the time they got his right! Unacceptable! Will probably not be back! Too bad. We feel like ever since the pandemic  the customer service industry has just gone downhill! They don't care at all
label: Complaint

review: So  went here for me and my boyfriends 1 year anniversary. The atmosphere was beautiful  very inviting. The salad bar was horrible. The food brought to you by waiters was good  the meat was great. But there were no sides....so it was a shitty salad bar with a lot of meat. It was $65 a plate  which honestly I'd rather go to a really fancy restaurant and get a MEAL..not some glorified BBQ. I would suggest replacing the literal potato salad and glazed peanut bar with vegetables  noodles  rice  mashed potatoes  stews. Went for the gimic  won't go back for the food.
label: Suggestion

review: The frybread was good but it didn't have any sauce or toppings other than lettuce and cheese which made it rather dry and chewy.
label: Complaint

review: We came here on NYE. Our service was great the waitress was a doll and I had no issues with that. The food is underwhelming and I think over priced. My tenderloin was small and lacked flavor: the pasta course was slimy and the broth was too strong. Salad was good. The crème brûlée which I would've loved to order was ruined by adding ginger. I got blackberry sorbet. Meh. For the cost of the food I would think they could update the interior  it is dated with diff light fixtures and no consistent design or ambience. Same as it was 15 years ago. The other restaurant they own is Acero and that is one of my favorite places. They are very nice here but I'm not rushing back.
label: Complaint

This locations has a pick up window and u can pay on line so make it extremely awesome and save specially during the pandemic before vaccines. is important to mention the people at the pick up window re always super nice never have any problems  no attitude and no drama. Has there been some mess ups? Of course. A couple of pizzas came out undercooked  or they get an order wrong. These are a rarity given the frequency of our orders but a quick call to the manager and they fix the problem right away either with re-macking the pizza or giving a credit for next order. The important thing is they have always made it right. review: This is a new Burmese/Thai/sushi restaurant on Northside of town across from North Central high-school. Cute little restaurant  clean  very atune service. Food was good. Got fried spring rolls  steamed chicken dumplings  pad ka prao minced chicken  and Burmese curry noodle soup. The soup was certainly the highlight of the meal. Very similar ingredients to a kao soi but no crunchy rice noodles and a thinner  "soupier" broth. Reminded me of consistency of a Tom kha soup. It was exceptional. The pad ka prao is sliced meat here but they made it thai style by request by mincing meat. The entree comes with side of jasmine rice topped with fried egg. The stir fry was good  not overly sweet or overly basil flavored. It is in the middle of pack as far as this particular dish goes around indy metro. The spring rolls and dumplings were both fair as well. Definitely will be back to try more entrees  menu items to gather better opinion. Great to have another thai spot in metro.

They're generous with their meats and noodles. The broth was a little lacking to me but nothing a little bit of fish sauce and hoisin/sriracha couldn't fix. I would also recommend their summer rolls. It was so fresh and now those were the best summer rolls I've ever had. I would definitely come back for them! I didn't try their Japanese cuisine but it was pretty much just sushi. A little bit on the pricey side but they have uni and toro! Now that's legit. Try them out if you like pho and sushi

My third course was another pasta option which was good but not bursting with flavor. When it came time for dessert  it had been over two hours since we started to eat so we decided to take it home. review: When you wake up groggy from a night of fighting with electrical issues  you want breakfast that can be delivered quick and be hearty. Well  I found it with Wendy's yesterday. Through their magical app  where you can also get points for freebies later  I placed the order for the fam  it gets dispatched to the store  and DoorDash handles the logistics. I was lucky enough to not only have a Dasher close by for immediate pickup  the order was correct  and most importantly HOT!!!! This store goes through its pains of staffing and sometimes does not always read notes in full. The only reason I'm giving 4-stars this go around is a miss on some order notes. When someone requests coffee with cream and sugar  sugar is not equal and sweet & low; both of which not the best for the body. Other than that the cold brew was amazing!!! Thanks for great food and a great recharge at an affordable value and was worth every bit of it and delivered in just about 25-30 minutes time. Can't wait to order again soon!!!

This time it seemed like there's less 'everything' on the croissant  the whole thing wasn't really warm  the eggs were weird flat scrambled patties  the cheese wasn't exactly melted  and the croissant itself wasn't as fluffy and awesome. The crispy potatoes were mostly whole. Don't get me wrong  the flavors were there. But it wasn't the same. If this is what it's going to be like from now on I'll be sad. Still top notch French 75s though!

The Mac and cheese are just spiral noodles with a wet cheese sauce  the sweet potatoes were cold and the marshmallows were charred but not warm (these were replaced and not charged when we requested a fresh order)  fries were delicious and flavorful  the cornbread was probably my favorite side  the succotash was also cold. review: I had a pizza craving and stopped here for a bite to eat. The pizza was fantastic and did not disappoint. The Toscano Pizza hit the spot with spinach  tomato and ricotta. I noticed they offer take out but no delivery which is another option. There are pasta choices too as the name implies. I have been here before and ordered a pasta meal. Either option is good eats. The only downside to this restaurant is the on-site parking. It wasn't an issue for me but could be a problem if you visit during a busy time. I did notice alternate parking on the other side of the street if on-site parking is not available.
